notes.orig_language_quote: הַ⁠בֹּ֖שֶׂם וְ⁠אֶת־הַ⁠שָּׁ֑מֶן לְ⁠מָא֕וֹר וּ⁠לְ⁠שֶׁ֨מֶן֙ הַ⁠מִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְ⁠לִ⁠קְטֹ֖רֶת הַ⁠סַּמִּֽים
notes.note: [Exodus 25:6](../25/06.md) has almost identical words, arranged slightly differently.

bsb_verse_text: So all the men and women of the Israelites whose hearts prompted them brought a freewill offering to the LORD for all the work that the LORD through Moses had commanded them to do.
ult_verse_text: The sons of Israel brought a freewill offering to Yahweh, every man and woman whose heart impelled them to bring {something} for all of the work which Yahweh had commanded {them} to do by the hand of Moses.

notes.note: The order of clauses in the ULT is reversed from the original because of required English sentence structure. In the original, **The sons of Israel brought a freewill offering to Yahweh** is at the end of the verse. Other languages may be able to retain the original order.

Here, **heart** refers to a persons’ will, their desire to do something. It is spoken of as causing a person to bring these gifts to Yahweh. See how you translated this in [25:2](../25/02.md) and [35:22](../35/22.md). Alternate translation: [whose will impelled them]

Here, **by the hand of Moses** refers to Moses as a messenger for Yahweh’s commands, not to Moses being the one who would build all these things. If this imagery of carrying a message would be misunderstood in your language, you may use another figure or translate the meaning. Alternate translation: [which Yahweh had told Moses to tell them to do]

bsb_verse_text: Then Moses said to the Israelites, “See, the LORD has called by name Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
ult_verse_text: And Moses said to the sons of Israel, “See, Yahweh has called by name on Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah.

notes.note: What Moses says in this verse is a quote from [Exodus 31:2](../31/02.md)
These are men’s names. See [31:2](../31/02.md).

bsb_verse_text: And He has filled him with the Spirit of God, with skill, ability, and knowledge in all kinds of craftsmanship,
ult_verse_text: And he has filled him with the Spirit of God, with skill and with understanding and with knowledge and with all kinds of craftsmanship

notes.note: This verse is a quote from [Exodus 31:3](../31/03.md)

Yahweh speaks of giving Bezalel his spirit as if Bezalel were a container and God’s spirit were a liquid. If your readers would not understand what this image means in this context, you could use an equivalent metaphor from your culture. Alternatively, you could express the meaning plainly. Alternate translation: [And he has given his spirit to Bezalel]
If your language does not use an abstract noun for this idea, you can express the idea behind the abstract noun **skill** in another way. Alternate translation: [so he can work skillfully]

If your language does not use an abstract noun for this idea, you can express the idea behind the abstract noun **understanding** in another way. Alternate translation: [and so he can understand his work]
If your language does not use an abstract noun for this idea, you can express the idea behind the abstract noun **knowledge** in another way. Alternate translation: [and so he knows his work well]

If your language does not use an abstract noun for **craftsmanship**, you can express the idea behind the abstract noun in another way. Alternate translation: [and for making all kinds of crafts] or [and so that he can make all kinds of things]

bsb_verse_text: to design artistic works in gold, silver, and bronze,
ult_verse_text: and to design designs, to work in gold and in silver and in bronze

notes.note: This verse is identical to [Exodus 31:4](../31/04.md), except for the first **and**.

bsb_verse_text: to cut gemstones for settings, and to carve wood, so that he may be a master of every artistic craft.
ult_verse_text: and in carving of precious stones for setting and in carving of wood, to do all kinds of craftsmanship of invention.

notes.note: This verse is identical to [Exodus 31:5](../31/05.md) except for the final **of invention**.

bsb_verse_text: And the LORD has given both him and Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, the ability to teach others.
ult_verse_text: And he has put {it} in his heart to teach, he and Oholiab the son of Ahisamak, from the tribe of Dan.

notes.note: Here, **put in his heart** is an idiom referring to ability and desire. These are spoken of as if they are something that could be placed in a heart. If it would be helpful in your language, you could use an equivalent idiom or use plain language. Alternate translation: [And he gave to them the ability and desire to teach]
These are names of men. See how you translated these names in [Exodus 31:6](../31/06.md).

bsb_verse_text: He has filled them with skill to do all kinds of work as engravers, designers, embroiderers in blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine linen, and as weavers—as artistic designers of every kind of craft.
ult_verse_text: He has filled them {with} skill of heart to do all of the work of a craftsman and of a skillful workman and of an embroiderer in the blue and in the purple and in the worm of scarlet and in the fine linen and of a weaver. {They are} doers of all work and designers of design.

notes.note: This verse summarizes and pulls together many previously mentioned things. See [28:3](../28/03.md) (**skill of heart**), [25:4](../25/04.md) (for materials), [26:36](../26/36.md) (**embroiderer**), [28:32](../28/32.md) (**weaver**), [26:31](../26/31.md) (**skillful workman**), [31:3](../31/03.md) (**craftsman**), [28:6](../28/06.md) (**designer of designs**).

Here, **skill** to create beautiful objects is spoken of as if it were something that could fill up a person. If your readers would not understand what this image means in this context, you could use an equivalent metaphor from your culture. Alternatively, you could express the meaning plainly. Alternate translation: [He has made them very skillful]
Here, **of heart** refers to possessing something, in this case ability or skill. Some languages will use a different body part for this image. Alternate translation: [with ability]

bsb_verse_text: “So Bezalel, Oholiab, and every skilled person are to carry out everything commanded by the LORD, who has given them skill and ability to know how to perform all the work of constructing the sanctuary.”
ult_verse_text: And Bezalel and Oholiab and every man skilled of heart to whom Yahweh has given skill and understanding to know {how} to do all of the work of the service of the Holy Place shall do according to all that Yahweh has commanded.”

notes.note: This verse is the end of a quotation from Moses that begin in [35:30](../35/30.md). It should be connected as visually as possible to the previous verses, as the chapter break here is poorly placed.
**Bezalel and Oholiab** are the names of men. See how you translated this in [Exodus 31:2](../31/02.md) and [31:6](../31/06.md) as well as in the end of [chapter 35](../35/30.md).
We know from [35:25](../35/25.md) that women were included in the skilled workers, so **man** means every person. Alternate translation: [person]
Here, **of heart** refers to innately possessing something, in this case ability or skill. Some languages will use a different body part for this image. Alternate translation: [with innate ability]

If your language does not use an abstract noun for this idea, you can express the idea behind the abstract noun **skill** in another way. See [35:31](../35/31.md). Alternate translation: [the ability to work skillfully]

If your language does not use an abstract noun for this idea, you can express the idea behind the abstract noun **understanding** in another way. See [35:31](../35/31.md). Alternate translation: [and so he can understand his work]

Here, **service** refers to worshiping Yahweh, and the phrase **work of the service** refers to building the Dwelling (**Holy Place**) where the Israelites would worship Yahweh. See [35:24](../35/24.md). Alternate translation: [the building of the Holy Place for worship]

bsb_verse_text: Then Moses summoned Bezalel, Oholiab, and every skilled person whom the LORD had gifted—everyone whose heart stirred him to come and do the work.
ult_verse_text: And Moses called to Bezalel and to Oholiab and to every man skilled of heart in whose heart Yahweh had put skill, all whose heart lifted him to come near to the work to do it,

notes.orig_language_quote: אֶל־בְּצַלְאֵ֘ל וְ⁠אֶל־אָֽהֳלִיאָב֒ וְ⁠אֶל֙ כָּל־אִ֣ישׁ חֲכַם־לֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧ן יְהוָ֛ה חָכְמָ֖ה בְּ⁠לִבּ֑⁠וֹ
notes.note: See how you translated this in the [previous verse](../36/01.md).
See how you translated **skill** in the [previous verse](../36/01.md).
See how you translated this in [35:21](../35/21.md).

bsb_verse_text: They received from Moses all the contributions that the Israelites had brought to carry out the service of constructing the sanctuary. Meanwhile, the people continued to bring freewill offerings morning after morning,
ult_verse_text: and they took from before the face of Moses all of the contributions that the sons of Israel had brought for doing the work of the service of the Holy Place. And they continually brought a freewill offering to him in the morning in the morning.

notes.note: Alternate translation: [and the craftsmen took]
Here, **before the face** means with Moses. Moses had received and kept the building materials. Alternate translation: [from the custody of]
This is an idiom meaning every morning or every day. Use a similar expression or translate the meaning. Alternate translation: [morning by morning]

bsb_verse_text: so that all the skilled craftsmen who were doing all the work on the sanctuary left their work
ult_verse_text: So all the skilled doing all the work of the Holy Place came, every single man from the work that they were doing,

notes.note: Here the adjective **skilled** is used as a noun in order to describe the group of craftsmen. Your language may use adjectives in the same way. If not, you could translate this with a noun phrase. Alternate translation: [the skilled workers]

Here, **every single man** translates an idiom that cannot be rendered literally and sensibly in English. The original is “a man a man.” If your language would use repetition to emphasize that each and every man came to see Moses, you could follow the original; otherwise use a phrase or structure that emphasizes that they all came. Alternate translation: [every man without exception]
As previously, noted, there were some women who contributed (particularly in the cloth crafts) so this use of **man** may include women. Alternate translation: [every single worker]

bsb_verse_text: and said to Moses, “The people are bringing more than enough for doing the work the LORD has commanded us to do.”
ult_verse_text: and they said to Moses, saying, “The people {are} bringing much more than enough for the service of the work that Yahweh has commanded {us} to do.”

notes.orig_language_quote: וַ⁠יֹּאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה לֵּ⁠אמֹ֔ר מַרְבִּ֥ים הָ⁠עָ֖ם לְ⁠הָבִ֑יא מִ⁠דֵּ֤י הָֽ⁠עֲבֹדָה֙ לַ⁠מְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה לַ⁠עֲשֹׂ֥ת אֹתָֽ⁠הּ
notes.note: If it would be more natural in your language, you could express this as an indirect quotation. Alternate translation: [The craftsmen told Moses that the people were bringing much more than enough for doing the work that Yahweh has commanded them to do]

bsb_verse_text: After Moses had given an order, they sent a proclamation throughout the camp: “No man or woman should make anything else as an offering for the sanctuary.” So the people were restrained from bringing more,
ult_verse_text: And Moses commanded, and they caused a sound to pass through in the camp, saying, “A man and a woman shall not make any more work for the contribution of the Holy Place.” And the people were restrained from bringing.

notes.orig_language_quote: אִ֣ישׁ וְ⁠אִשָּׁ֗ה אַל־יַעֲשׂוּ־ע֛וֹד מְלָאכָ֖ה לִ⁠תְרוּמַ֣ת הַ⁠קֹּ֑דֶשׁ
notes.note: If it would be more natural in your language, you could express this as an indirect quotation. Alternate translation: [that no one should bring any more contributions for the work of the Holy Place]
Here, **sound** refers to the message. This means they spread Moses’ message orally. Alternate translation: [everyone to share this message]

Here, **man and woman** is intended to mean everyone, or in this case because of the negation, no one. If it would be helpful in your language, you could use an equivalent expression or plain language. Alternate translation: [No one shall make]
Here, **work** means the sorts of crafted items listed in the previous chapter.
In some languages you may need to provide an object for this sentence. Alternate translation: [from bringing contributions]

bsb_verse_text: since what they already had was more than enough to perform all the work.
ult_verse_text: And the work was sufficient for doing all their work, and there was excess.

notes.note: Here, **work** means the sorts of crafted items listed in the previous chapter.

bsb_verse_text: All the skilled craftsmen among the workmen made the ten curtains for the tabernacle. They were made of finely spun linen, as well as blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, with cherubim skillfully worked into them.
ult_verse_text: And every skilled of heart among the doers of the work made the Dwelling with ten curtains: twisted fine linen and blue and purple and worm of scarlet; cherubim—the work of a skilled craftsman he made them.

notes.note: Except for tense and the addition of **every skilled of heart among the doers of the work,** this verse is identical to [Exodus 26:1](../26/01.md).
See how you translated this in [35:21](../35/21.md).

Throughout [verses 8–38](../36/08.md) the word **he** used. This is a generic noun referring to any of the team of skilled craftsmen. If this would be misunderstood in your language, use a more natural phrase. Alternate translation: [they made] or [a craftsman made]

bsb_verse_text: Each curtain was twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide; all the curtains were the same size.
ult_verse_text: The length of each curtain {was} 28 cubits and the width of each curtain {was} four cubits. All of the curtains {were} one size.

notes.note: These verses are almost identical to [Exodus 26:2–10](../26/02.md). Tense is implied.

bsb_verse_text: He also made fifty bronze clasps to join the tent together as a unit.
ult_verse_text: And he made 50 clasps of bronze to join the tent to be one.

notes.note: This verse is similar to [Exodus 26:11](../26/11.md). The difference is the absence of the middle clause from [26:11](../26/11.md).

bsb_verse_text: Additionally, he made for the tent a covering of ram skins dyed red, and over that a covering of fine leather.
ult_verse_text: And he made a covering for the tent of reddened hides of rams and a covering of hides of sea-cows above that.

notes.note: These verses are almost identical to [Exodus 26:14–15](../26/14.md).

bsb_verse_text: Each frame was ten cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
ult_verse_text: The length of a frame {was} ten cubits, and the width of one frame {was} a cubit and a half of a cubit.

notes.note: This verse is identical to [Exodus 26:16](../26/16.md).

bsb_verse_text: Two tenons were connected to each other for each frame. He made all the frames of the tabernacle in this way.
ult_verse_text: {There were} two tenons in each frame for joining one to one. Thus he made all of the frames of the Dwelling.

notes.note: These verses are almost identical to [Exodus 26:17–20](../26/17.md).

bsb_verse_text: and forty silver bases—two bases under each frame.
ult_verse_text: and their 40 silver bases: two bases under one frame, and two bases under one frame.

notes.note: This verse is identical to [Exodus 26:21](../26/21.md).

bsb_verse_text: He made six frames for the rear of the tabernacle, the west side,
ult_verse_text: And he made six frames for the back side of the Dwelling, toward the west.

notes.note: These verses are almost identical to [Exodus 26:22–23](../26/22.md).

bsb_verse_text: coupled together from bottom to top and fitted into a single ring. He made both corners in this way.
ult_verse_text: And they were a pair at the bottom, and they were completely together at the top to one ring. Thus he did for both as the two corners.

notes.note: These verses are very similar to [Exodus 26:24–25](../26/24.md).

bsb_verse_text: So there were eight frames and sixteen silver bases—two under each frame.
ult_verse_text: And there were eight frames and their silver bases, sixteen bases: two bases, two bases under one frame.

notes.orig_language_quote: שְׁנֵ֤י אֲדָנִים֙ שְׁנֵ֣י אֲדָנִ֔ים תַּ֖חַת הַ⁠קֶּ֥רֶשׁ הָ⁠אֶחָֽד
notes.note: The list formula from [26:25](../26/25.md) is strangely shortened here but has the same meaning. If it would be helpful to your readers, you could express that explicitly.

bsb_verse_text: He also made five crossbars of acacia wood for the frames on one side of the tabernacle,
ult_verse_text: And he made crossbars of wood of acacias—five for the frames of the one side of the Dwelling,

notes.note: These verses are almost identical to [Exodus 26:26–27](../26/26.md).

bsb_verse_text: He made the central crossbar to run through the center of the frames, from one end to the other.
ult_verse_text: And he made the middle crossbar in the center of the frames to pass through from end to end.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 26:28](../26/28.md).

bsb_verse_text: And he overlaid the frames with gold and made gold rings to hold the crossbars. He also overlaid the crossbars with gold.
ult_verse_text: And he covered the frames with gold. And he made their rings of gold, the holders for the crossbars. And he covered the bars with gold.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 26:29](../26/29.md).

bsb_verse_text: Next, he made the veil of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely spun linen, with cherubim skillfully worked into it.
ult_verse_text: And he made a curtain of blue and purple and worm of scarlet and of twisted fine linen. He made cherubim, the work of a skillful workman.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 26:31](../26/31.md).

bsb_verse_text: He also made four posts of acacia wood for it and overlaid them with gold, along with gold hooks; and he cast four silver bases for the posts.
ult_verse_text: And he made for it four pillars of acacia wood, and he covered them {with} gold and their hooks with gold. And he cast for them four bases of silver.

notes.note: Aside from some verbal differences, this verse is very similar to [Exodus 26:32](../26/32.md).

bsb_verse_text: For the entrance to the tent, he made a curtain embroidered with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely spun linen,
ult_verse_text: And he made a curtain for the entrance of the tent: of blue and purple and worm of scarlet and of twisted fine linen, the work of an embroiderer,

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 26:36](../26/36.md).

bsb_verse_text: together with five posts and their hooks. He overlaid the tops of the posts and their bands with gold, and their five bases were bronze.
ult_verse_text: and its five pillars and their hooks. And he covered their tops and their rings {with} gold. And their five bases {were} bronze.

notes.note: See how you translated many of these words in [Exodus 26:37](../26/37.md).

bsb_verse_text: Bezalel went on to construct the ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
ult_verse_text: And Bezalel made the box of wood of acacias—its length {was} two cubits and a half, and its width {was} one cubit and a half, and its height {was} one cubit and a half.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 25:10](../25/10.md).

bsb_verse_text: He overlaid it with pure gold, both inside and out, and made a gold molding around it.
ult_verse_text: And he overlaid it {with} pure gold, inside and outside, and for it he made a border of gold around {it}.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 25:11](../25/11.md).

bsb_verse_text: And he cast four gold rings for its four feet, two rings on one side and two on the other.
ult_verse_text: And he cast four rings of gold for it on its four feet: two rings on its one side and two rings on its second side.

notes.note: These verses are almost identical to [Exodus 25:12–14](../25/12.md).

bsb_verse_text: He constructed a mercy seat of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
ult_verse_text: And he made an atonement lid of pure gold. Its length {was} two cubits and a half, and its width {was} a cubit and a half.

notes.note: These verses are almost identical to [Exodus 25:17–20](../25/17.md).

bsb_verse_text: He also made the table of acacia wood two cubits long, a cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high.
ult_verse_text: And he made the table from wood of acacias. Its length {was} two cubits, and its width {was} a cubit, and its height {was} a cubit and a half.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 25:23–27](../25/23.md).

bsb_verse_text: He made the poles of acacia wood for carrying the table and overlaid them with gold.
ult_verse_text: And he made the poles {out of} wood of acacias and covered them {with} gold to carry the table.

notes.note: These verses are very similar to [Exodus 25:28–29](../25/28.md).

bsb_verse_text: Then he made the lampstand out of pure hammered gold, all of one piece: its base and shaft, its cups, and its buds and petals.
ult_verse_text: And he made the lampstand of pure gold. The lampstand—its base and its shaft—were made of hammered work. Its cups, its buds, and its blossoms were from it.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 25:31](../25/31.md).

bsb_verse_text: Six branches extended from the sides, three on one side and three on the other.
ult_verse_text: And six branches were going out from its sides, three branches of the lampstand from the one side and three branches of the lampstand from the second side.

notes.note: These verses are identical to [Exodus 25:32–34](../25/32.md).

bsb_verse_text: A bud was under the first pair of branches that extended from the lampstand, a bud under the second pair, and a bud under the third pair.
ult_verse_text: And a bulb {was} under two of the branches from it, and a bulb {was} under two of the branches from it, and a bulb {was} under two of the branches from it—for all six branches extending out from it.

notes.note: These verses are almost identical to [Exodus 25:35–36](../25/35.md).

bsb_verse_text: He also made its seven lamps, its wick trimmers, and trays of pure gold.
ult_verse_text: And he made its seven lamps and its tongs and its trays of pure gold.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical with [Exodus 25:37–38](../25/37.md), excluding the purpose clause in v. 37 (“and it will hold up its lamps, and it will make light on the side of its face”).

bsb_verse_text: He made the lampstand and all its utensils from a talent of pure gold.
ult_verse_text: He made it and all its items from a talent of pure gold.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 25:39](../25/39.md).

bsb_verse_text: He made the altar of incense out of acacia wood. It was square, a cubit long, a cubit wide, and two cubits high. Its horns were of one piece.
ult_verse_text: And he made the altar of incense of wood of acacias. Its length {was} one cubit, and its width one cubit. It {was} square, and its height {was} two cubits. Its horns were part of it.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 30:1–2](../30/01.md).

bsb_verse_text: And he overlaid with pure gold the top and all the sides and horns. Then he made a molding of gold around it.
ult_verse_text: And he overlaid it {with} pure gold—its top and all around its sides and its horns—and he made for it a border of gold around {it}.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 30:3](../30/03.md).

bsb_verse_text: He made two gold rings below the molding on opposite sides to hold the poles used to carry it.
ult_verse_text: And he made two rings of gold for it under its border on its two sides, on its two sides; for housings for the poles for carrying it with them.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 30:4](../30/04.md).

bsb_verse_text: And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
ult_verse_text: And he made the poles of wood of acacias, and he overlaid them {with} gold.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 30:5](../30/05.md).

bsb_verse_text: He also made the sacred anointing oil and the pure, fragrant incense, the work of a perfumer.
ult_verse_text: And he made the oil of anointment of holiness and the pure incense of fragrance, the work of an ointment maker.

notes.note: For the **oil**, see [Exodus 30:25](../30/25.md), and for the **incense** see [25:6](../25/06.md) and [30:35](../30/35.md).

bsb_verse_text: Bezalel constructed the altar of burnt offering from acacia wood. It was square, five cubits long, five cubits wide, and three cubits high.
ult_verse_text: And he made the altar of the burnt offering of wood of acacias. Its length {was} five cubits and its breadth {was} five cubits—a square—and its height {was} three cubits.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 27:1](../27/01.md).

bsb_verse_text: He made a horn at each of its four corners, so that the horns and altar were of one piece, and he overlaid the altar with bronze.
ult_verse_text: And he made its horns on its four corners; its horns were part of it. And he overlaid it {with} bronze.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 27:2](../27/02.md).

bsb_verse_text: He made all the altar’s utensils of bronze—its pots, shovels, sprinkling bowls, meat forks, and firepans.
ult_verse_text: And he made all of the equipment of the altar: the pots and the shovels and the basins, the meat forks and the firepans. He made all of its equipment {of} bronze.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 27:3](../27/03.md).

bsb_verse_text: He made a grate of bronze mesh for the altar under its ledge, halfway up from the bottom.
ult_verse_text: And he made a grate for the altar, a work of a network of bronze under its ledge, from below to its middle.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 27:4](../27/04.md) and [Exodus 27:5](../27/05.md). One part of [27:4](../27/04.md) is rearranged into [38:5](../38/05.md).

bsb_verse_text: At the four corners of the bronze grate he cast four rings as holders for the poles.
ult_verse_text: And he cast four rings on the four ends for the grate of bronze, as holders for the poles.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to the second half of [Exodus 27:4](../27/04.md).

bsb_verse_text: And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.
ult_verse_text: And he made the poles of wood of acacias, and overlaid them {with} bronze.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 27:6](../27/06.md).

bsb_verse_text: Then he inserted the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar for carrying it. He made the altar with boards so that it was hollow.
ult_verse_text: And he put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, to carry it with them. He made it hollow, of planks.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 27:7](../27/07.md) and the first part of [27:8](../27/08.md).

bsb_verse_text: Next he made the bronze basin and its stand from the mirrors of the women who served at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
ult_verse_text: And he made a basin of bronze and its base of bronze with the mirrors of the serving {women} who served at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

notes.orig_language_quote: וַ⁠יַּ֗עַשׂ אֵ֚ת הַ⁠כִּיּ֣וֹר נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וְ⁠אֵ֖ת כַּנּ֣⁠וֹ נְחֹ֑שֶׁת
notes.note: This portion is almost identical to [Exodus 30:18](../30/18.md).

bsb_verse_text: Then he constructed the courtyard. The south side of the courtyard was a hundred cubits long and had curtains of finely spun linen,
ult_verse_text: And he made the courtyard. For the south side, the curtains of the courtyard {were} 100 cubits of fine twisted linen,

notes.note: This verse is similar to [Exodus 27:9](../27/09.md).

bsb_verse_text: with twenty posts and twenty bronze bases, and with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
ult_verse_text: {with} their 20 pillars and their 20 bronze bases, the hooks of the pillars and their rings of silver.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 27:10](../27/10.md).

bsb_verse_text: The north side was also a hundred cubits long, with twenty posts and twenty bronze bases. The hooks and bands of the posts were silver.
ult_verse_text: And for the north side, 100 cubits {with} their 20 pillars and their 20 bases of bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their rings {were} of silver.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 27:11](../27/11.md).

Here, “the curtains of the courtyard” and “long” are both omitted. If it would be helpful in your language, you could supply these words from the context. Alternate translation: [the curtains of the courtyard were 100 cubits long]

bsb_verse_text: The west side was fifty cubits long and had curtains, with ten posts and ten bases. The hooks and bands of the posts were silver.
ult_verse_text: And the curtains for the side of the west {were} 50 cubits, with their ten pillars and their ten bases. The hooks of the pillars and rings {were} of silver.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 27:12](../27/12.md).

bsb_verse_text: And the east side, toward the sunrise, was also fifty cubits long.
ult_verse_text: And for the east side 50 cubits.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 27:13](../27/13.md).

bsb_verse_text: The curtains on one side of the entrance were fifteen cubits long, with three posts and three bases.
ult_verse_text: The curtains to the side {were} fifteen cubits {with} their three pillars and their three bases.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 27:14](../27/14.md).

bsb_verse_text: And the curtains on the other side were also fifteen cubits long, with three posts and three bases as well.
ult_verse_text: And for the second side from this, and from this to the gate of the courtyard, the curtains {were} fifteen cubits {with} their three pillars and their three bases.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 27:15](../27/15.md).

bsb_verse_text: The bases for the posts were bronze, the hooks and bands were silver, and the plating for the tops of the posts was silver. So all the posts of the courtyard were banded with silver.
ult_verse_text: And the bases for the pillars {were} bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their rings {were} silver, and the plating of their tops {was} silver. And all of the pillars of the courtyard {were} filleted {with} silver.

notes.note: See how you translated many of these words in [Exodus 27:17](../27/17.md).

bsb_verse_text: The curtain for the entrance to the courtyard was embroidered with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely spun linen. It was twenty cubits long and, like the curtains of the courtyard, five cubits high,
ult_verse_text: And the curtain of the gate of the courtyard {was the} work of an embroiderer, blue and purple and worm of scarlet and twisted fine linen. And the length {was} twenty cubits and the height in width {was} five cubits, just as the curtains of the courtyard,

notes.note: See how you translated many of these words in [Exodus 27:16](../27/16.md) and [18](../27/18.md).

If it would be helpful to your readers, you could express this in terms of modern measurements, either in the text or a footnote. A cubit is approximately 46cm. For your reference, a more precise conversion to metric is: 9.2m … 2.3m

This probably refers to the general dimensions (20 cubits long by 5 cubits wide) but clarifies that the **width** would become the **height** of the curtain when the craftsmen or Levites set up the Dwelling. Alternate translation: [and the width, which corresponded to the height when hung, was five cubits]

bsb_verse_text: with four posts and four bronze bases. Their hooks were silver, as well as the bands and the plating of their tops.
ult_verse_text: with their four pillars and their four bases {which were} bronze, and their hooks {which were} silver, and the plating of their tops and its rings {which were} silver.

notes.note: See how you translated many of these words in [Exodus 27:17](../27/17.md).

bsb_verse_text: All the tent pegs for the tabernacle and for the surrounding courtyard were bronze.
ult_verse_text: And all the tent pegs for the Dwelling and for the courtyard all around {were} bronze.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to the second half of [Exodus 27:19](../27/19.md).

bsb_verse_text: This is the inventory for the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the Testimony, as recorded at Moses’ command by the Levites under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
ult_verse_text: These {are} the records of the Dwelling, the Dwelling of the Testimony which was recorded according to the mouth of Moses, the work of the Levites by the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

notes.note: If your language does not use the passive form in this way, you can state this in active form or in another way that is natural in your language. Alternate translation: [which the Levites recorded]

This is an idiom referring to Moses telling them to make these records. If it would be helpful in your language, you could use an equivalent idiom or use plain language. Alternate translation: [following Moses’ instructions]

Here, **by the hand of** could mean: (1) Ithamar was in charge of the group that recorded these records (2) Ithamar was the scribe who actually wrote these records. Alternate translation: [under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest] or [written down by Ithamar son of Aaron the priest]
**Ithamar** is the name of a man. See how you translated this name in [Exodus 6:23](../06/23.md).

bsb_verse_text: Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made everything that the LORD had commanded Moses.
ult_verse_text: And Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah, made everything that Yahweh had commanded Moses.

notes.note: **Bezalel**, **Uri,** and **Hur** are the names of men. See how you translated these in [Exodus 31:2](../31/02.md).

This sentence leaves out some of the words that a sentence would need in many languages to be complete. If it would be helpful in your language, you could supply these words. Alternate translation: [Moses to do]

bsb_verse_text: With him was Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, designer, and embroiderer in blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine linen.
ult_verse_text: And Oholiab son of Ahisamak, from the tribe of Dan, an engraver and a designer and an embroiderer in blue and in purple and in scarlet and in fine linen, {was} with him.

notes.note: **Oholiab** and **Ahisamak** are names of men. See how you translated these in [Exodus 31:6](../31/06.md).
This is very similar to part of [Exodus 35:35](../35/35.md).

bsb_verse_text: All the gold from the wave offering used for the work on the sanctuary totaled 29 talents and 730 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
ult_verse_text: All the gold used for the work, in all the work of the sanctuary—it was the gold from the raised offering—{was} 29 talents and 730 shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary.

notes.note: If your language does not use the passive form in this way, you can state this in active form or in another way that is natural in your language. Alternate translation: [All the gold that the craftsmen used]

notes.orig_language_quote: תֵּ֤שַׁע וְ⁠עֶשְׂרִים֙ כִּכָּ֔ר וּ⁠שְׁבַ֨ע מֵא֧וֹת וּ⁠שְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּ⁠שֶׁ֥קֶל הַ⁠קֹּֽדֶשׁ
notes.note: A talent is about 34 kilograms, and a shekel is about 11 grams. If it would be helpful to your readers, you could express this in terms of modern measurements, either in the text or a footnote.

bsb_verse_text: The silver from those numbered among the congregation totaled 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel—
ult_verse_text: And the silver of the counted of the congregation {was} 100 talents and 1, 775 shekels, by the shekel of the sanctuary,

ult_verse_text: a beka for a head (half a shekel), by the shekel of the sanctuary, from every passer over to the counted ones from a son of 20 years and older—from 603, 550.

notes.note: See how you translated many of the same things in [Exodus 30:13–14](../30/13.md).

bsb_verse_text: The hundred talents of silver were used to cast the bases of the sanctuary and the bases of the veil—100 bases from the 100 talents, one talent per base.
ult_verse_text: And 100 talents of silver were cast for the bases of the sanctuary and the bases of the curtain—100 bases for the 100 talents, a talent for a base.

notes.note: A talent is about 34 kilograms. If it would be helpful to your readers, you could express this in terms of modern measurements, either in the text or a footnote.

bsb_verse_text: With the 1,775 shekels of silver he made the hooks for the posts, overlaid their tops, and supplied bands for them.
ult_verse_text: And he made hooks for the pillars with the 1, 775. And he overlaid their tops and filleted them.

notes.note: Here the words **shekels of silver** have been omitted because they are understood from [38:25](../38/25.md). If it would be helpful in your language, you could supply these words from the context. Alternate translation: [the 1,775 shekels of silver]
See how you translated some of these in [Exodus 27:17](../27/17.md).

bsb_verse_text: The bronze from the wave offering totaled 70 talents and 2,400 shekels.
ult_verse_text: And the bronze of the raised offering {was} 70 talents and 2, 400 shekels.

notes.note: A talent is about 34 kilograms, and a shekel is about 11 grams. If it would be helpful to your readers, you could express this in terms of modern measurements, either in the text or a footnote.

bsb_verse_text: He used it to make the bases for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar and its bronze grating, all the utensils for the altar,
ult_verse_text: And with it he made the bases of the entrance of the tent of meeting and the altar of bronze and its grate of bronze and all the equipment of the altar

notes.note: A **grate** is a frame of crossed bars for holding wood when burning. See how you translated this in [Exodus 27:4](../27/04.md).

bsb_verse_text: the bases for the surrounding courtyard and its gate, and all the tent pegs for the tabernacle and its surrounding courtyard.
ult_verse_text: and the bases of the surrounding courtyard and the bases of the entrance of the courtyard and all of the tent pegs of the Dwelling and all of the tent pegs of the surrounding courtyard.

notes.note: These are sharp bronze stakes that were used to secure the corners of a tent to the ground. See how you translated this in [Exodus 27:19](../27/19.md).

bsb_verse_text: From the blue, purple, and scarlet yarn they made specially woven garments for ministry in the sanctuary, as well as the holy garments for Aaron, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
ult_verse_text: And from the blue and the purple and the worm of scarlet they made finely-woven clothes for service in the Holy Place. And they made the clothes of holiness which {were} for Aaron, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

notes.note: See how you translated similar instructions in [Exodus 28:4–5](../28/04.md).

If your language does not use an abstract noun for the idea of **holiness**, you can express the same idea in another way. See how you translated this in [28:2](../28/02.md). Alternate translation: [the holy clothes]

bsb_verse_text: Bezalel made the ephod of finely spun linen embroidered with gold, and with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn.

bsb_verse_text: They made shoulder pieces for the ephod, which were attached at two of its corners, so it could be fastened.
ult_verse_text: They made joined shoulder pieces for it. It was joined on its two corners.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [28:7](../28/07.md).

bsb_verse_text: And the skillfully woven waistband of the ephod was of one piece with the ephod, of the same workmanship—with gold, with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and with finely spun linen, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
ult_verse_text: And the skillfully crafted sash of the ephod which is on it was from it, of like workmanship, of gold, blue, and purple and worm of scarlet and twined fine linen, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 28:8](../28/08.md).

bsb_verse_text: They mounted the onyx stones in gold filigree settings, engraved like a seal with the names of the sons of Israel.

ult_verse_text: And he put them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as stones of reminder for the sons of Israel, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to the first half of [Exodus 28:12](../28/12.md).

bsb_verse_text: He made the breastpiece with the same workmanship as the ephod, with gold, with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and with finely spun linen.
ult_verse_text: And he made the breastpiece, the work of a skillful craftsman, like the work of the ephod, from gold, blue, and purple and worm of scarlet and twisted fine linen.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 28:15](../28/15.md); a few words are omitted here.

bsb_verse_text: It was square when folded over double, a span long and a span wide.
ult_verse_text: It was square, folded double. They made the breastpiece, its length: a span; and its width: a span folded double.

bsb_verse_text: And they mounted on it four rows of gemstones: The first row had a ruby, a topaz, and an emerald;
ult_verse_text: And they set in it four rows of precious stones. The first row {was} a row of a ruby, of a topaz, and of a garnet.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 28:17](../28/17.md).

notes.note: This verse is identical to [Exodus 28:18](../28/18.md).

bsb_verse_text: the third row had a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
ult_verse_text: And the third row: a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst.

notes.note: This verse is identical to [Exodus 28:19](../28/19.md).

ult_verse_text: And the fourth row: a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. {The stones were} surrounded by ornamental gold settings.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 28:20](../28/20.md).

bsb_verse_text: The twelve stones corresponded to the names of the sons of Israel. Each stone was engraved like a seal with the name of one of the twelve tribes.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 28:22](../28/22.md).

bsb_verse_text: They also made two gold filigree settings and two gold rings, and fastened the two rings to the two corners of the breastpiece.

bsb_verse_text: Then they fastened the two gold chains to the two gold rings at the corners of the breastpiece,

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [Exodus 28:24](../28/24.md).

ult_verse_text: And they made two rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulder pieces of the ephod on the bottom of the front of its face, close to its joining above the skillfully crafted waistband of the ephod.

notes.note: This verse is identical to [Exodus 28:27](../28/27.md) except for verb tense.

notes.note: This verse is very similar to [Exodus 28:37](../28/37.md).

bsb_verse_text: So all the work for the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, was completed. The Israelites did everything just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
ult_verse_text: And all the service of the Dwelling, the tent of meeting, was finished. And the sons of Israel did according to all that Yahweh had commanded Moses; thus they did.

notes.note: This verse marks the end of the narrative of the construction of the Dwelling. More precisely, it seems to mark the beginning of an ending section. Use the natural form in your language for expressing the conclusion of a story.

The **tabernacle** and **tent of meeting** are the same thing. The two interchangeable terms are brought together here in a poetic doubling to bring this part of the narrative to a close. If your readers would find this confusing you may need to simplify to one or expand in explanation like in the UST. Alternate translation: [holy meeting tent]

notes.orig_language_quote: וַֽ⁠יַּעֲשׂוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּ֠⁠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ
notes.note: Here, **thus they did** parallels the whole rest of the sentence. Like the doubling of the terms for **tabernacle** this brings the narrative of building to an emphatic conclusion. If this sort of parallelism would convey a meaning other than this emphatic conclusion in your language you may need to use another natural way to close the narrative with emphasis on the Israelites complete obedience. Alternate translation: [And the sons of Israel faithfully did exactly according to all that Yahweh had commanded Moses]

notes.orig_language_quote: וַ⁠תֵּ֕כֶל כָּל־עֲבֹדַ֕ת מִשְׁכַּ֖ן אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַֽ⁠יַּעֲשׂוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּ֠⁠כֹל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ
notes.note: This verse starts a short narrative of the Israelites bringing and presenting the items for the Dwelling to Moses for inspection. It is a summary of the construction and extended conclusion to the last few chapters. Your team may need to decide how to group [verse 32](../39/32.md), as it both closes the construction narrative and introduces this next section, which ends with a very similar summary statement in [39:42–43](../39/42.md).

bsb_verse_text: Then they brought the tabernacle to Moses: the tent with all its furnishings, its clasps, its frames, its crossbars, and its posts and bases;
ult_verse_text: And they brought the Dwelling to Moses: the tent and all its equipment and its clasps and its frames and its bars and its pillars and its bases;

notes.note: This verse, especially the list of items, is very similar to [35:11](../35/11.md).

bsb_verse_text: the covering of ram skins dyed red, the covering of fine leather, and the veil of the covering;
ult_verse_text: and the covering of reddened hides of rams and the covering of hides of sea-cows and the curtain of covering;

notes.orig_language_quote: וְ⁠אֶת־מִכְסֵ֞ה עוֹרֹ֤ת הָֽ⁠אֵילִם֙ הַ⁠מְאָדָּמִ֔ים וְ⁠אֶת־מִכְסֵ֖ה עֹרֹ֣ת הַ⁠תְּחָשִׁ֑ים
notes.note: See how you translated similar phrases to this in [Exodus 26:14](../26/14.md).
See how you translated similar phrases to this in [35:12](../35/12.md).

bsb_verse_text: the ark of the Testimony with its poles and the mercy seat;
ult_verse_text: the Box of the Testimony and the poles and the atonement lid;

notes.note: See how you translated similar phrases to this in [35:12](../35/12.md).

bsb_verse_text: the table with all its utensils and the Bread of the Presence;
ult_verse_text: the table with all of its equipment and the bread of the faces;

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to [35:13](../35/13.md).

bsb_verse_text: the pure gold lampstand with its row of lamps and all its utensils, as well as the oil for the light;
ult_verse_text: the pure lampstand with its lamps, lamps of the row, and all its accessories and the oil of the light;

notes.note: These verses are very similar to [35:14–15](../35/14.md).

bsb_verse_text: the bronze altar with its bronze grating, its poles, and all its utensils; the basin with its stand;
ult_verse_text: the altar of bronze and the grate of bronze that {is} for it, its poles and all of its utensils, the basin and its base;

notes.note: This verse is almost identical with [35:16](../35/16.md).

bsb_verse_text: the curtains of the courtyard with its posts and bases; the curtain for the gate of the courtyard, its ropes and tent pegs, and all the equipment for the service of the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting;
ult_verse_text: the curtains of the courtyard, its pillars and bases and the curtain of the gate of the courtyard, its ropes and its tent pegs and all the items of the service of the Dwelling for the tent of meeting;

notes.note: This verse is almost identical with [35:17](../35/17.md) and parts of [35:18](../35/18.md).
These refer to the same place. See how you translated the doubling in [39:32](../39/32.md). Alternate translation: [the Dwelling, that is the tent of meeting]
This verse is identical to [35:19](../35/19.md).

bsb_verse_text: The Israelites had done all the work just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
ult_verse_text: Thus the sons of Israel did all the work according to all that Yahweh had commanded Moses.

notes.note: This verse is almost identical to the second half of [39:32](../39/32.md).

bsb_verse_text: And Moses inspected all the work and saw that they had accomplished it just as the LORD had commanded. So Moses blessed them.
ult_verse_text: And Moses saw all of the work, and behold, they had done it. Just as Yahweh had commanded, thus they had done. And Moses blessed them.

notes.note: Here, the word **behold** draws attention to the information that follows. Use a word or marking in your language that draws attention to the next information.

This (and really [verse 42](../39/42.md)) is the end of the conclusion of the construction of materials portion of the story. The ending began in [39:32](../39/32.md). If your language has specific features that should be part of the end of a section like this, consider using them here.

bsb_verse_text: Then the LORD said to Moses,
ult_verse_text: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

notes.note: There is a transition to a new event at the beginning of this chapter. Use the natural form in your language for introducing a new event.

bsb_verse_text: “On the first day of the first month you are to set up the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting.
ult_verse_text: “On the first day of the month, in the first month, you shall raise up the Dwelling of the tent of meeting.

notes.note: If your language does not use ordinal numbers, you can use cardinal numbers here. Alternate translation: [On day one of the month, in month one]
These refer to the same place. See how you translated the doubling in [39:32](../39/32.md). Alternate translation: [the Dwelling, that is the tent of meeting]

Here, the new or next year is omitted because it can be inferred from context. However, if that would be misunderstood by your readers (perhaps they would think it just meant “next month” or something), you could add a phrase to make it clear that it is the first month of the year. This refers to exactly one year after God rescued his people from Egypt. See [Exodus 12:2](../12/02.md). Alternate translation: [month of the year]

bsb_verse_text: Put the ark of the Testimony in it and screen off the ark with the veil.
ult_verse_text: And you shall place the Box of the Testimony there, and you shall cover over the box with the curtain.

notes.note: Alternate translation: [and you shall conceal]

bsb_verse_text: Place the gold altar of incense in front of the ark of the Testimony, and hang the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
ult_verse_text: And you shall put the altar of gold for incense before the face of the Box of the Testimony, and you shall place the curtain of the gate to the Dwelling.

notes.note: Alternate translation: [in front of]

bsb_verse_text: Place the altar of burnt offering in front of the entrance to the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting.
ult_verse_text: And you shall put the altar of the burnt offering before the face of the gate of the Dwelling, the tent of meeting.

notes.note: Alternate translation: [in front of]
These refer to the same place. See how you translated the doubling in [39:32](../39/32.md). Alternate translation: [the Dwelling, that is the tent of meeting]

bsb_verse_text: Anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils; consecrate the altar, and it shall be most holy.
ult_verse_text: And you shall anoint the altar of the burnt offering and all its utensils. And you shall set apart the altar, and the altar will be a holiest holy thing.

notes.note: Here, **holiest holy** means extremely or uniquely holy. If this form would not express that this item would become uniquely holy in your language you may need to find another way to express this idea. See how you translated this in [Exodus 29:37](../29/37.md). Alternate translation: [a most holy thing] or [extraordinarily holy]

bsb_verse_text: Then bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and wash them with water.
ult_verse_text: And you shall bring Aaron and his sons to the gate of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.

notes.note: Verses 12–15 are similar to [Exodus 29:4–9](../29/04.md).

bsb_verse_text: Moses did everything just as the LORD had commanded him.
ult_verse_text: And Moses did according to all that Yahweh had commanded him. Thus he did.

notes.note: This statement starts a new section in which Moses does all the things **just as Yahweh had commanded**; this poetic obedience statement was seen so often in the previous chapter. You may wish to mark this transition and poetic statement in a particular way in your language that is similar to how you did in the last chapter. See [39:32](../39/32.md).

bsb_verse_text: So the tabernacle was set up on the first day of the first month of the second year.
ult_verse_text: And it was in the first month, the second year, on the first of the month {that} the Dwelling was raised up.

notes.note: The use of the passive here indicates that the important thing is the completion of the task of setting up the tent on the specific date Yahweh had commanded. If your language would show that focus in a different way, use a natural form to do that. Alternate translation: [that they set up the Dwelling]

notes.orig_language_quote: בַּ⁠חֹ֧דֶשׁ הָ⁠רִאשׁ֛וֹן בַּ⁠שָּׁנָ֥ה הַ⁠שֵּׁנִ֖ית בְּ⁠אֶחָ֣ד לַ⁠חֹ֑דֶשׁ
notes.note: This refers to exactly one year after God rescued his people from Egypt. See [Exodus 12:2](../12/02.md).
If your language does not use ordinal numbers, you can use cardinal numbers here. Alternate translation: [in month one, year two, on day one of]

bsb_verse_text: When Moses set up the tabernacle, he laid its bases, positioned its frames, inserted its crossbars, and set up its posts.
ult_verse_text: And Moses raised up the Dwelling and placed its bases and set up its frames and placed its bars and set up its pillars.

notes.note: Moses was the leader. It would have been impossible for him to do all this personally; the people helped him set up the Dwelling. All references to Moses from here to all the Dwelling assembly listing through [40:33](../40/33.md) can be understood this way. Alternate translation: [And Moses directed the people to raise up the Dwelling, and they placed its bases]

bsb_verse_text: Moses took the Testimony and placed it in the ark, attaching the poles to the ark; and he set the mercy seat atop the ark.
ult_verse_text: And he took the testimony and put {it} into the box. And he put the poles on the box and put the atonement lid on the top of the box.

notes.note: In this verse and the next, there may be an exception to the word **he** meaning someone who was helping Moses, because these items were especially sacred. If you have been using a form that indicates that people are helping Moses construct the Dwelling, you may consider switching to “Moses” here.

bsb_verse_text: Then he brought the ark into the tabernacle, put up the veil for the screen, and shielded off the ark of the Testimony, just as the LORD had commanded him.
ult_verse_text: And he brought the box into the Dwelling. And he set up the curtain of covering, and he covered over the Box of the Testimony, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

notes.note: In this verse and the previous verse, there may be an exception to the word **he** meaning someone who was helping Moses, because these items were especially sacred. If you have been using a form that indicates that people are helping Moses construct the Dwelling, you may consider switching to “Moses” here.

bsb_verse_text: He arranged the bread on it before the LORD, just as the LORD had commanded him.
ult_verse_text: And he arranged on it the arrangement of bread before the face of Yahweh, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

notes.note: Alternate translation: [in the presence of]

bsb_verse_text: and set up the lamps before the LORD, just as the LORD had commanded him.
ult_verse_text: And he lifted up the lamps before the face of Yahweh, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

notes.note: Alternate translation: [in the presence of]

bsb_verse_text: Moses placed the gold altar in the Tent of Meeting, in front of the veil,
ult_verse_text: And he put the altar of gold into the tent of meeting in front of the face of the curtain.

notes.note: Alternate translation: [in front of]

bsb_verse_text: and he burned fragrant incense on it, just as the LORD had commanded him.
ult_verse_text: And he caused smoke on it, incense of fragrance, just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

bsb_verse_text: Moses was unable to enter the Tent of Meeting because the cloud had settled on it, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
ult_verse_text: And Moses was not able to go into the tent of meeting, because the cloud had settled on it and the glory of Yahweh had filled the Dwelling.

notes.orig_language_quote: וְ⁠לֹא־יָכֹ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֗ה לָ⁠בוֹא֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד כִּֽי־שָׁכַ֥ן עָלָ֖י⁠ו הֶ⁠עָנָ֑ן וּ⁠כְב֣וֹד יְהוָ֔ה מָלֵ֖א אֶת־הַ⁠מִּשְׁכָּֽן
notes.note: If it would be more natural in your language, you could reverse the order of these phrases since the second phrase gives the reason for the result that the first phrase describes. Alternate translation: [Because the cloud had settled on it and the glory of Yahweh had filled the Dwelling, Moses was not able to go into the tent of meeting.]

bsb_verse_text: Whenever the cloud was lifted from above the tabernacle, the Israelites would set out through all the stages of their journey.
ult_verse_text: And whenever the cloud was taken up from over the Dwelling, the sons of Israel would set out on all their travels,

notes.note: If your language does not use the passive form in this way, you can state this in active form or in another way that is natural in your language. Alternate translation: [Whenever Yahweh’s cloud moved]

bsb_verse_text: If the cloud was not lifted, they would not set out until the day it was taken up.
ult_verse_text: but if the cloud was not taken up, then they would not set out until the day it was taken up.

notes.orig_language_quote: וְ⁠אִם־לֹ֥א יֵעָלֶ֖ה הֶ⁠עָנָ֑ן וְ⁠לֹ֣א יִסְע֔וּ עַד־י֖וֹם הֵעָלֹתֽ⁠וֹ
notes.note: If your language does not use the passive form in this way, you can state this in active form or in another way that is natural in your language. Alternate translation: [but if Yahweh did not take up the cloud, then they would not set out until the day he took it up.]

bsb_verse_text: For the cloud of the LORD was over the tabernacle by day, and fire was in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel through all their journeys.
ult_verse_text: For the cloud of Yahweh {was} over the Dwelling by day, and fire was on it by night, before the eyes of all the house of Israel in all their travels.

notes.note: Here, **before the eyes of** refers to being able to see. All the Israelites could see the cloud and fire. Alternate translation: [and all the house of Israel could see it]

Here, **house** represents a people group, the Israelites, who were descended from Jacob, who was also named Israel. If it would be helpful in your language, you could use a metaphor from your language or translate the meaning. This is a common biblical metaphor, so you may want to check other places this occurs. The **house of Israel** is equivalent to “sons of Israel” or “Israelites.”
